Class Join

  • java.lang.Object
    • Join
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Rhomb

    public class Join
extends java.lang.Object
implements Rhomb, java.io.Serializable
    A class representing the intersection of two Yarns (pseudolines). The Joins may shift about relative to one another, but each Join always refers to the same two Yarns. This was created to be a faster alternative to SimpleRhomb, but it doesn't seem to be much faster in practice.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • type

        public final int type
        The congruence class of rhomb. Given by the difference of the angles of its Yarns.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Join

        public Join(Point p,
    Yarn y1,
    Yarn y2)
        Public constructor.
        Parameters:
        p - A reference point indicating the corner of the rhomb with even angle and two outward-pointing arrows.
        y1 - The first Yarn incident with this Join.
        y2 - The second Yarn incident with this Join.

      • onEdge

        public boolean onEdge()
        Determine if this Join is on the edge of a pseudoline arrangement.
        Specified by:
        onEdge in interface Rhomb
        Returns:
        true if, for each of the two Yarns, this is either the first or last Join.

      • shift

        public void shift(Point vector)
        Shift the point by a given vector. This means that, when we draw the rhomb represented by this Join, it will be shifted.
        Specified by:
